intro: Roemeria procumbens, commonly known as the creeping roemeria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, spreading stems that often lie close to the ground, producing small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, peppery scent when crushed. Roemeria procumbens is often found in grassy areas and along woodland edges, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
